org.gearvrf

Class GVREventManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVREventManager

  • public class GVREventManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides API for event-related operations in the framework. In the framework, events are categorized into groups, each of which is represented by an interface extending the tag interface IEvents. For example, the event group IScriptEvents contain life-cycle events IScriptEvents.onInit(GVRContext), and per-frame callbacks IScriptEvents.onStep().

    Other event groups can be defined in similar ways. As seen above, we don't necessarily use classes to represent events themselves, but we may create event classes (such as MouseEvent) to represent details of an event, and pass it to an event handler.

    An event handler can take one of the two forms. 1) It can be a class implementing an event interface in Java. 2) It can be a script in a scripting language, such as Lua and Javascript. In the scripting case, the prototype of the function mirrors their Java counterpart. For example, a handler function in Lua for IScriptEvents.onInit(GVRContext) is

     
 function onInit(gvrf)
    ...
 end

    • Method Detail

      • sendEvent

        public boolean sendEvent(java.lang.Object target,
                         java.lang.Class<? extends IEvents> eventsClass,
                         java.lang.String eventName,
                         java.lang.Object... params)
        Delivers an event to a handler object. An event is sent in the following way:

        1. If the target defines the interface of the class object eventsClass, the event is delivered to it first, by invoking the corresponding method in the target.
        2. If the target implements interface IEventReceiver, the event is delivered to listeners added to the GVREventReceiver object. See GVREventReceiver for more information.
        3. If the target is bound with scripts, the event is delivered to the scripts. A script can be attached to the target using GVRScriptManager.attachScriptFile(IScriptable, GVRScriptFile).
        Parameters:
        target - The object which handles the event.
        eventsClass - The interface class object representing an event group, such as IScriptEvents.class.
        eventName - The name of the event, such as "onInit".
        params - Parameters of the event. It should match the parameter list of the corresponding method in the interface, specified by event class
        Returns:
        true if the event is handled successfully, false if not handled or any error occurred.
